Item.name: Nuclear Reactor (Mini)
Item.description: Usable device for generating electrical power. A successfull miniaturization of small-modular-reactor architecture, compact enough to see use on some shuttle craft for extended range.

Item.name: Nuclear Reactor (Small)
Item.description: Usable device for generating electrical power. An undersized reactor unit for vessels with lower power requirements.

Item.name: Slow Nuclear Reactor (Small)
Item.description: Nuclear power generation design which is designed for high-mass reaction and efficient usage of fuel at sub-critical levels.

Item.name: Diesel Biofuel
Item.description: Hydrocarbon-based fuel used by diesel generators.

Item.name: Fusion Fuel (Tritium Deuterium)
Item.description: Conventional fusile material which predates the colonies. However due to the immense colony resource demands, production of viable tritium deuterium fuel on industrial scale is still very costly.

Item.name: Fusion Fuel (Oxygenite)
Item.description: A mixture of pressurized oxygenite vapor and lithium dust. The process takes advantage of oxygenite's unique metaphysical properties, producing an easy-fusing fuel but relatively low effective output.

Item.name: Fusion Fuel (Helium-3)
Item.description: A naturally occuring but thinly scattered fusile material. Sometimes found in large veins with other radioactive minerals or within' icy asteroids, making it a relatively easy fuel source to come by - until recently.

Item.name: Fusion Fuel (Alien Cell)
Item.description: Experimental fusile matter supply powered by an alien cell. Capable of producing a very energetic reaction, however its exact function is not well understood.

Item.name: Fusion Reactor (Small)
Item.description: Miniaturized magnetic-confinement fusion reactor utilizing a spherical Tokamak configuration. Capable of using a wide variety of fuel mixtures.

Item.name: Fusion Reactor (Medium)
Item.description: Compact Stellarator fusion reactor which circulates particles along a twisting path for improved stability. Capable of using a wide variety of fuel mixtures.
